pullRequest.body:
Add some general purpose lemmas on lists. Also execute two adaptation notes.
The lemmas are taken from https://github.com/sven-manthe/A-formalization-of-Borel-determinacy-in-Lean

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [ef166b9612](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18349/commits/ef166b9612534b2b6559f38d0df1a20a5a2ff448)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsPrefix.drop`
`+ IsPrefix.take`
`+ drop_take_append_drop`
`+ drop_take_append_drop'`
`+ eq_nil_or_concat'`
`+ isPrefix_append_of_length`
`+ left_eq_take_iff`
`+ map_inits`
`+ map_tails`
`+ take_concat_get'`
`+ take_eq_left_iff`
`+ take_eq_self_iff`
`+ take_inits`
`+ take_isPrefix_take`
`+ take_self_eq_iff`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

(If you want, you could certainly split this into several PRs, for instance one on the adaptation notes and another for the `List/Infix` changes. I would approve both right away. This might speed up reviews, but I am aware this may cause additional overhead for you.)
Thanks! I have a few style comments and a few questions. I don't know this part of mathlib well - so take my comments around naming and library design with a pinch of salt.
Thanks! I have a few style comments and a few questions. I don't know this part of mathlib well - so take my comments around naming and library design with a pinch of salt.

Can you use `(n : )` before the colon, please? Here and elsewhere.
(I had no idea you could simply write `n`, TIL --- but that does not match the rest of the file.)
I wonder if `take_isPrefix_iff` would be a better name.
`take_isPrefix_take_iff`, maybe?
Since `take_eq_take` already exists, I'll use `take_isPrefix_take`
I wonder: would `take_eq_self_iff` be a better name?
Same for the following lemmas.
Please indent this line by four spaces.
Same here.

I'd write this as
```suggestion
/-- Compared to `drop_take_append_drop`, the order of summands is swapped. -/
```
And I wonder: are really *both* lemmas useful, and should they both be simp lemmas?
Of course, they are trivially equivalent, but because `m+n` and `n+m` may both occur a subterms of a term in simp normal form, having both lemmas just makes simp more powerful
This makes me wonder if `take_concat_get` should be changed instead.
I would have done this if it were part of mathlib and not core
I have the glaring feeling this proof can be optimised. I'm not familiar enough with the library around lists to quickly suggest how, though. Perhaps another reviewer can provide some feedback.
Your feeling was right
Do you have an idea why this change is necessary?

`take_succ` and `Iff.symm take_concat_get'` are almost the same lemma. Thus removing the new global simp lemma `take_concat_get'` from the local simp set and leaving `take_succ` in there also works, but the old simp set looped.

```suggestion
/-- `take_concat_get` in simp normal form -/
```

```suggestion
/-- `eq_nil_or_concat` in simp normal form -/
```

pullRequest.title: feat: add list lemmas
